name: Writing Revision Rubric
description: Evaluation criteria for three-pass revision quality

criteria.name: Clutter Reduction (Pass 1)
criteria.description: Effectiveness of cutting adverbs, qualifiers, passive voice, weak verbs, and throat-clearing

scores.1: No clutter reduction; draft unchanged or worse
scores.2: Minimal cutting; most clutter remains, less than 5% reduction
scores.3: Moderate cutting; some clutter removed but significant waste remains (5-10% reduction)
scores.4: Good cutting; most clutter removed with 10-20% word count reduction
scores.5: Excellent cutting; all clutter eliminated, 10-25% reduction, every word earns its place

criteria.name: Cognitive Load Reduction (Pass 2)
criteria.description: Effectiveness of fixing garden-paths, buried topics, and ensuring first-reading comprehension

scores.1: No cognitive load improvements; sentences still require re-reading
scores.2: Minimal improvements; most garden-paths and buried topics remain
scores.3: Some improvements; obvious issues fixed but subtle problems remain
scores.4: Good improvements; most sentences parse correctly on first reading
scores.5: Excellent improvements; all sentences clear on first reading, topics signaled early, pronouns unambiguous

criteria.name: Rhythm and Flow (Pass 3)
criteria.description: Quality of sentence variety, strong endings, and gold-coin distribution

scores.1: Monotonous rhythm; all sentences similar length, weak endings throughout
scores.2: Slight variety; some length variation but still feels flat
scores.3: Moderate variety; some short punchy sentences and strong endings
scores.4: Good variety; deliberate length variation, mostly strong endings, some gold-coins placed
scores.5: Excellent rhythm; strategic variety, strong endings, gold-coins throughout, reads aloud beautifully

criteria.name: Analysis Thoroughness
criteria.description: Whether each pass included complete analysis before improvement

scores.1: No analysis performed; edits made without systematic review
scores.2: Partial analysis; only first section analyzed
scores.3: Moderate analysis; most of draft covered but gaps exist
scores.4: Good analysis; entire draft analyzed with specific findings documented
scores.5: Comprehensive analysis; complete draft analyzed, all issues catalogued in analysis files

criteria.name: Meaning Preservation
criteria.description: Whether the author's intended meaning and voice were preserved through revision

scores.1: Meaning significantly altered; author's intent lost
scores.2: Some meaning changes; key points distorted by aggressive editing
scores.3: Meaning mostly preserved; minor unintended shifts
scores.4: Meaning well preserved; author's voice and intent clear throughout
scores.5: Meaning perfectly preserved; all improvements enhance without altering intent or voice

passing_note: Average score must be >= 3.5 for revision to be considered complete. Scores below 3 in 'Cognitive Load Reduction' or 'Meaning Preservation' require re-revision.
